TestCase.Title: Test case TLS_A2_FR_04
TestCase.Purpose: This test verifies the CA of the client certificate that is sent by the DUT upon request.
TestCase.Precondition: The test TLS server is waiting for incoming TLS connections on [URL].

Command.Text: The tester causes the DUT to connect to the TLS server on [URL].

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS server receives a ClientHello handshake message from the DUT.

Command.Text: The TLS server answers the DUT choosing a TLS version and a cipher suite that is contained in the ClientHello.

TestStep.Description: The server sends a CertificateRequest to the DUT.
The server supplies the certificate chain [CERT_DEFAULT].
No TLS extensions are supplied by the server which are not required to conduct the TLS handshake.

ExpectedResult.Text: The DUT supplies a valid client certificate that was issued by the CA stated in the ICS.
The TLS protocol is executed without errors and the channel is established.
